    • Method Detail

      • canFindUniqueElement

        public static boolean canFindUniqueElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                           org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
        Returns True if only one element matches the locator specified, and Returns false (with a descriptive error) if no elements were found, or if more than one element was found.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        Returns:
        boolean value, true if the element is found and unique, and false if the element is not found or is not unique

      • canFindUniqueElement

        public static boolean canFindUniqueElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                           org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                           int timeout)
        Returns True if only one element matches the locator specified, and Returns false (with a descriptive error) if no elements were found, or if more than one element was found. You can manually set the timeout (in seconds) given that it will be multiplied by 4.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        timeout - controls the wait timeout until the target element is present on the current page
        Returns:
        boolean value, true if the element is found and unique, and false if the element is not found or is not unique

      • internalCanFindUniqueElement

        public static boolean internalCanFindUniqueElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                                   org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
        For internal use ONLY inside the ElementActions library, Custom Validations package, and the Screenshooter class. Returns True if only one element matches the locator specified, and Returns false (with a descriptive error) if no elements were found, or if more than one element was found.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        Returns:
        boolean value, true if the element is found and unique, and false if the element is not found or is not unique

      • internalCanFindUniqueElement

        public static boolean internalCanFindUniqueElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                                   org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                                   int timeout)
        For internal use ONLY inside the Custom Validations package (AssertElementExists(false). Returns True if only one element matches the locator specified, and Returns false (with a descriptive error) if no elements were found, or if more than one element was found.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        timeout - controls the wait timeout until the target element is present on the current page
        Returns:
        boolean value, true if the element is found and unique, and false if the element is not found or is not unique

        public static void type(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                        org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                        String text)
        Checks if there is any text in an element, clears it, then types the required string into the target element.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        text - the target text that needs to be typed into the target webElement

      • typeFileLocationForUpload

        public static void typeFileLocationForUpload(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                             org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                             String absoluteFilePath)
        Types the required file path into an input[type='file'] button, to successfully upload the target file.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        absoluteFilePath - the full path to the file that needs to be uploaded

      • typeAppend

        public static void typeAppend(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                              org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                              String text)
        Appends the required string into the target element, regardless of the current text value.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        text - the target text that needs to be appended into the target webElement

      • select

                          org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                          String text)
        Selects an element from a dropdown list using its displayed text
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        text - the text of the choice that you need to select from the target dropDown menu

      • keyPress

        public static void keyPress(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                            org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                            String key)
        Sends a keypress to the target element. Supported keys are: ENTER, RETURN, TAB
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        key - the key that should be pressed

      • dragAndDrop

        public static void dragAndDrop(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                               org.openqa.selenium.By sourceElementLocator,
                               org.openqa.selenium.By destinationElementLocator)
        Drags the source element and drops it onto the destination element using javascript
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        sourceElementLocator - the locator of the source webElement that should be dragged under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        destinationElementLocator - the locator of the target webElement that should receive the dropped source element under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)

      • getText

      • getAttribute

        public static String getAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                  org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                  String attributeName)
        Retrieves a certain attribute's value from the target element and returns it as a string value.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        attributeName - the target attribute of the webElement under test
        Returns:
        the value of the target attribute of the webElement under test

      • waitForTextToChange

        public static void waitForTextToChange(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                       org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                       String initialValue)
        Waits dynamically for a specific element's text to change from the initial value to a new unknown value
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        initialValue - the initial text value of the target webElement

      • isElementDisplayed

        public static boolean isElementDisplayed(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                         org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
        Checks to see if an element is displayed
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        Returns:
        boolean value, true if the element is displayed, and false if the element is not displayed
